intro: Eleocharis coronata, commonly known as the crowned spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that are often surrounded by a crown of bracts, giving it its common name. Its rhizomes help stabilize soil in marshy environments, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems. Eleocharis coronata typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, and it blooms during the summer months.
